metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The Cross is the decisive turning point.

mapping_structuur.doel_element: A fundamental change in cosmic history

cognitieve_implicaties: History has a trajectory and a specific destination.
theologische_implicaties: The death of Christ is the center of time.
ethische_implicaties: One must align their life with this new direction.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Linear view of time may marginalize cyclical or eternal perspectives.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Commonly used in Christian discourse but revitalized here by the etymological link to 'crucial'.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: An enemy lodges... in our own hearts.

mapping_structuur.bron_element: A hostile soldier occupying a house
mapping_structuur.doel_element: Sinful impulses occupying the human soul

cognitieve_implicaties: The self is a divided territory; internal conflict is inevitable.
theologische_implicaties: Sin is an active, hostile force, not just a lack of good.
ethische_implicaties: Constant vigilance and 'warfare' against one's own impulses.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher uses contemporary military imagery (Iraq war, POWs) to make the 'enemy' metaphor visceral.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher maintains a tight focus on the 'Shame/Honor' and 'Juridical' domains, using the historical reality of the cross to anchor abstract theological concepts of forgiveness.

succesvolle_blending.locatie: Discussion of the Cross as a 'religious symbol' vs 'instrument of brutality'
succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher uses 'Schema Disruption' to strip the religious veneer off the cross, forcing the hearer to see the 'Source' (torture) before the 'Target' (salvation).

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the 'dead' metaphor of the cross by detailing the sensory horrors (smell, sound, nudity).
sterktes.voorbeeld: the horrific sight of completely naked men in agony, the smell and sight of their bodily functions

risicos.beschrijving: Graphic descriptions of torture might overwhelm the theological message for sensitive hearers.
risicos.voorbeeld: pinning the victims up like insects
risicos.potentiele_impact: Emotional trauma or focus on gore rather than grace.

sub_worlds: Modern war zones (Iraq, World Trade Center)
The 'religious' world of Easter cards and jewelry

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective in bridging the historical gap.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By linking the mocking of Jesus to lynchings and terrorism.

verstoorde_schemas.schema_naam: The Cross as a Pretty Religious Symbol
verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Contrast with the 'obscene' and 'repulsive' reality of Roman execution.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: The Cross as a 'Ritual of Humiliation'.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Perfectly fits the Good Friday 'Solemn Reproaches' or 'Tenebrae' atmosphere.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the 'SHAME/HONOR' and 'CRIME/PUNISHMENT' domains. It successfully avoids the 'ECONOMIC' (transactional) trap often found in Good Friday sermons, focusing instead on the 'embodiment' of human cruelty and the 'absorption' of that cruelty by God.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Link forgiveness to the physical 'absorption' of pain mentioned earlier.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Forgiveness is the body of Christ acting as a sponge for the world's venom.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from 'God as Father' to 'Jesus as the one praying' could be tighter.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Emphasize the 'Relational' bond between the Father and Son to explain why the prayer has 'divine power'.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests we are victims of an invader rather than responsible agents.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'washing hands' metaphor used elsewhere to reinforce agency.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To soften the heavy juridical/military tone and offer a sense of 'healing' for the 'heart-enemy'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to de-romanticize religious language and confront the hearer with the 'scandal' of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the vivid imagery, CMT reveals how that imagery functions to overwrite the 'safe' religious schema of the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's learning styles, CMT shows that the 'feeling' and 'thinking' are both rooted in the 'embodied' experience of shame and physical pain.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher is using the 'CONTAINER' schema (sin in the heart) to move the target of the sermon from 'them' (the Romans/terrorists) to 'us' (the congregation).

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Grip of something they do not comprehend
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'SHAME IS A VISIBLE MARK' schema prevalent in Near Eastern cultures to explain the Passion.
